Reviews.Title: “Ares Hotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Tasselchof
Reviews.Content: I had been in this hotel with my wife. This hotel have the best location - in a two steps from all facilities. Breakfast is good and, what is most important for me, staff can leave it for me, when i am getting up too late. Hotel have a good teracce with magnificent view and good food in the restaurant. All staff are very polite and make my stay unforgetable.

Reviews.Title: “Ares hotel”
Reviews.Author: AthensWorldwide
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ares hotel for 5 nights along with my sister and we were very satisfied. Firstly, the location is great for tourists as it is exactly opposite the most outstanding landmarks of Istanbul. Also, the staff and the service are excellent professionals, very helpful and kind. Finally, the rooms we had was beautiful, specious enough and newly redecorated. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a brilliant location along with a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Jura K
Reviews.Content: I found Ares hotel accidentally but it was a great surprise when me and my friend came here. The atmosphere in the hotel is very warm, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. You can get very useful suggestions about any activity in Istanbul from the staff. The most important thing about the hotel is that its location is perfect. You can reach any object of interest (Hagia Sophia, Cystern, Topkapi palace, Blue Mosque, etc.) on foot. The food is just wonderful, very tasty and represents the national kitchen! Also you get a discount for any meal if you stay in the hotel. So it was a great surprise for us and unforgetable time in the city. Lets try the ARES!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendtly staff”
Reviews.Author: maria m
Reviews.Content: Stayed Aes at the April 2012. The staff are fantastic. I was a solo traveller and they made me feel very welcome - like a home from home. They were happy to make me a tea and coffee after my day exploring Istanbul. They gave me tips and advice on what to do/see in Old city . They were absolutely brilliant. Ayhan and Bunyamin The hotel is in a fantastic location. Right next to the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosgue in OLD City . Everything is accesible from here. Tram stop is very close by. The Turkissh Islamic art is a 10 minute walk away. The tram is a 5 minute walk away which takes you to Taksim Square and Istiklal Street Great Value for Old city

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ares sultanachmed Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Lamoel
Reviews.Content: Nice omelet. Nice location near the Hagia Sofia, blue moskque, tram and on the basiliek system. And very friendly personnel! Great terras where you can see almost half of Istanbul. Milan

Reviews.Title: “"Great Hotel - Perfect location"”
Reviews.Author: Mariya_london
Reviews.Content: It's an excellent place and I highly recommend it. Location is perfect, the staff was also very nice and so helpful....

Reviews.Title: “FawziDenmark2012”
Reviews.Author: Fawzi F
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was very excellent. You have everything next to you. It is a hotel with a excellent staff and they are so kind and friendly. The breakfast was not the best but ok. But sitting outside the hotel was so relaxing. I can recommended Ares Hotel. See you again guys

Reviews.Title: “â€œPerfect Hotel and Service with a smileâ€�”
Reviews.Author: scheers
Reviews.Content: I Was travel solo, five minutes walk from Blue Mosgue, five minutes walk from Hagia Sophia, its ++ conviniently located. Breakfast was OK but boring same everyday . Hotel is great and clean everyday . Breakfast is served at Lobby 7.30Am To 10.00 everyday which has not great cause they have lovely teracce. The best thing was Ayhan Salur hospitality - he was always available for help. He helped in getting currency exchanged, helped in loading credit on his mobile phone , you name it and he was there to help.Mr salur will arrange any tour you may wish to take & service is excellent. This hotel is excellent value. Highly recommended. I fully recommend this and will certainly stay here when next travel to Sultanahmet . Thanks Ayhan for making my stay wonderfull. It's be good to take the wife next time,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Araceli M
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location, you can go walking to the most important and historical places in Istanbul. The rooms are small but clean and confortable. The best at hotel is the staff, they are friendly, polite, kind and help you in everything, thanks especially Mr, Ayhan Salur for his hospitality and efficiency.

Reviews.Title: “ARES HOTEL REAL JEWIL ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: yolanda s
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Ares where we stayed at the Istanbull Oldcity . It was our first trip to Turkey and we wanted to make sure everything all t right. We were looking for a clean , friendly ,Our rooms little small and Open buffet breakfast was average , comfortable no-nonsense, and conveniently located hotel, in which we could feel welcome and humor Location was perfect for us. The owner and manager was very attentive and pleasant, especially Ayhan Salur, the manager very helpful! He really took an interest in us and gave some great Tour and restaurant recommendations. Ayhan arranged transportation from the Cruiseport to the hotelt, where we departed on a Ataturk Airport He also suggested a help for Cappadocia and Ephesus, which was located in the next block, for an all day tour. We were pleased with the travel agency staff, the tour guide and the price. The rooftop is an excellent place for views and coctail ; however,. We all agreed that if we return to Istanbul, and we hope we do, We cant wait to come back to Istanbul full of history and definitly iWewill stay again at Ares Hotel OLDCÄ°TY

Reviews.Title: “Fine as long as you don't spend much time in the room”
Reviews.Author: Sarah A
Reviews.Content: The room itself was very no-frills and had some major drawbacks. It was very small, and seemed clean enough but not especially clean. Noise from the street sounded as if it was happening right in the room and often woke me up early in the morning. The sink in the bathroom had some smelly mothballs in it when I checked in--I'm still confused about that. Overall the room felt sort of depressing. The wifi was very spotty within the room, but worked okay in the lobby or restaurant downstairs. The free breakfast was great: fresh, a lot of variety, and plenty of food. Hotel staff were kind and helpful. I got charged an extra fee for using a credit card, which really aggravated me, but when I checked in it was midnight and I was exhausted and not in the mood to argue or understand his explanation. The location is also great and very close to many of the most popular tourist destinations. However, the address of the hotel is on a small pedestrian-only side street. No taxi driver knows where this street is, and you will save yourself a LOT of aggravation if you look at a map online and find a nearby street address on the main road, and give that to cab drivers instead of the true address.

Reviews.Title: “Good & bad”
Reviews.Author: Katarina A
Reviews.Content: We checked in late in the evening and were expecting warm welcome and fast check in as were very tired. But we were really frustrated when instead of professionally looking and behaving receptionist we saw a middle aged man in striped shirt, playing Internet games in the lobby. But to our surprise in the morning we were welcomed by a different receptionist - very neat, professionally looking and always smiling. He wished us a good morning and followed till the breakfast hall. And after the breakfast we were already enjoying our Turkish teas in the lobby in his company and getting all necessary information about Istanbul. So we can say he is doing a great job! In spite of the first night bad experience we spent lovely time in Ares hotel thanks to the day shift guy.

Reviews.Title: “My new friends in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: 1judith11
Reviews.Content: After some difficulty finding the hotel, I received a warm welcome. The staff were very kind and helpful to a single older woman. The hotel is small and next to the Basilica Cistern and across from the H. Sophia and within easy walking to the Blue Mosque, and next to the tram line. Most rooms are a decent size with a modern three piece bathroom, satellite t.v., and a bar fridge, but no phone. My single room was very small and with the exception that the toilet was in with the shower. This is not unusual but not always convenient. There is an elevator but it does not go right to the ground. You must walk down several short flights of stairs to the street. The breakfast was tasty and plentiful. The roof top restaurant is pleasant if somewhat plain, but the view was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bonbon23
Reviews.Content: Ares Hotel is a nice choice of a hotel because of the good combination of price and location. The hotel staff are also excellent and very polite. They will help you out with anything you need, and will make sure your stay is comfortable. About the hotel: first of all, it's in a great location - two minutes from Sultanahmet tram station which connects you to various areas in the city; Aya Sofya and Sultan Ahmet Mosque are a short walk away. Now, the rooms are really small, but I guess that's how it is if you want a reasonable price at the prime location. Housekeeping does a good job at cleaning the room. Just like some others have mentioned, there is some unpleasant smell coming out of bathroom but I did notice that the housekeeping used some bleach-like substance to try and reduce that smell. Wifi was spotty; I couldn't get a good signal at my room, so I had to go to the restaurant where the signal was strong. The top floor terrace has a wonderful view of Aya Sofya, but it is open only at night. Breakfast is a standard fare of bread, coffee or tea, jam, cheeses, olives, and vegetables. Nothing spectacular but a solid choice to start the day. All in all, it is a good hotel, which I recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely small room but very helpful employees”
Reviews.Author: Stelly70
Reviews.Content: We had a room that would have been small for just a single person and there were two twin beds cramed in. I had to crawl over one bed to get into the other one. The location couldn't have been any better. we were able to walk anywhere we wanted to go. The tram line was convenient if you wanted to ride it. The employees were very helpful and spoke English quiet well. We were not able to eat breakfast before leaving for the airport so they made sandwiches for us to take with us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice people, terrible rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Patricksfolly
Reviews.Content: For the good points: You can't beat the location near the Blue Mosque. The owners are very nice. The room was pretty clean and tidy. Now the bad points: Rooms are small. If you're traveling with more than one person you'd be cramped. French doors that lead into a concrete wall and a small passage that goes into the alley. Can you say security risk! The bathroom is pretty small, but usable. The biggest complaint, however, is that the walls are almost literally paper thin. I could hear everything happening in this hotel. I could the woman next door brushing her hair. I'm not exaggerating. It's terrible! I had to make a phone call back to the States at 4am before the banks closed and I'm talking in a fairly low tone and the neighbors are beating on the walls and door telling me to shut up. Then I realize that you could hear an ant crawl across the floor in this place and I'm thinking, great! Now everyone in Turkey knows my business! I would say avoid this place unless you are hard up. The WiFi was spotty at best.

Reviews.Title: “Small, cozy, on a small street, in the centre of Istanbul, balcony with fantastic panorama view, 1st stop of sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: MargaritkaDinkova
Reviews.Content: Very well-mannered service , careful, make me feel special, smiling all the time. The rooms are compactly designed (without orientally design), with air-conditioner, TV, Internet network, telephones. The service rooms have bath-tub. The room space is very optimally organized. The hotel is on small, quiet street in the top of the centre in Istanbul. Had a perfect transport connection. It's about 2 minutes to the mosque of Saint Sofia, about 1 minute to tramway stop Sultan Pasha. The most important it's the first and beggining stop of Sight Seeing. I like a lot the service, the location of the hotel and the balcony, and at least the size of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic deal”
Reviews.Author: untilitsleepsm
Reviews.Content: My Swedish Friend & myself "Egyptian" have chosen Ares hotel amongst hundreds of hotels in Istanbul, there were a lot of positive reviews about it specially the location and the warm friendly atmosphere of the friendly staff, and here it's my turn to be one of those guests and to happily get few minutes to submit my own experience. The hotel was clean & our room has been cleaned on daily basis, hot water and heater were working perfectly. The room was relatively small but has all the basic facilities with comfy beds. The hotel location is right in the heart of the old part of Istanbul, it takes about 150-200 Meters to Hagia Sophia then crossing the main street to reach The Blue Mosque. Being very close to the Tram station made our travelling with public transportation very smooth and cheap. Breakfast was kinda basic with 2 kind of cream cheese :-) I've no doubts that I'll get back to Ares hotel. Ahmed & Jens.

Reviews.Title: “A Warm Welcome in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: meh777
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and the room is clean. The hotel staff is very accommodating and friendly. With all these things, you will surely enjoy your stay in Istanbul. Thanks to all of you! :)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, well located and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: brightsound
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right at the heart of old Istanbul and it is perfect for a relaxing holiday stay. There are numerous restaurants on the doorstep and the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. I thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only for convenience of location for visiting Historic city.”
Reviews.Author: edwynr
Reviews.Content: Great location. Restaurant small, but food good. Breakfast choice non existent. I do not know about other rooms, but ours was far from clean and the bathroom was constantly smelling, the odour probably coming from the bathroom exhaust system of the hotel. Rooms are small, but that could be because of the central location. All in all not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very near main attractions, acceptable for everything else”
Reviews.Author: lozzie1
Reviews.Content: Everyone says how near this hotel is to Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace and the Basilica Cistern and they are not wrong. Sleep quality poor as it can be noisy in the street in front of the hotel. The hotel is on a side street, not a main road, but it's full of restaurants, so quite a lot of coming and going. Also, the call to prayer at the mosque starts pretty early and can be heard loud and clear in the room we stayed in - first floor at the front. I found the breakfast different (it included olives), but a good start anyway. We were 3 girls, and booked a triple room, but got a double and a single. It was not possible to have 3 separate beds in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, noisy room!”
Reviews.Author: Bevelini
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends came to Istanbul for 3 nights... the Ares Hotel is in a perfect location near the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace and the Basilica Cistern... also only 10 mins walk to the Grand Bazaar. Staff were friendly but sometimes a little over friendly. We had a room on the first floor which was really noisy, even though it had double glazing and the staff smoke in reception which wafted up the stairs and into our room. Lots of good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, excellent location, new hotel and a verry good staff”
Reviews.Author: TravellorIB
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been way better than we expected it to be, not the mention the service that we have gotten from the staff. I came here with my family (parents) and my mother has a handicap and they helpen me allot during my stay. The location is excellent, its like 20m from Hagia Sophia and 30m from the Blue Mosque. The hotel is on the basilica cistern and on a very close walking distance of the grand bazaar and topcapi palace.

Reviews.Title: “best location and very good service”
Reviews.Author: halima_10
Reviews.Content: i strongly recommand this location for the following reasons : - located near a lot of restaurant and the best tourist areas - a very nice terrace with a nice view - a very nice and helpfull staff have fun adil and halima from casablanca

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: ian_lane802
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ares is perfectly located in the Sultanhamet area of the city, and most of the things you would want to see are within a very short walking distance, The room we had was quite small, but perfectly adequate and clean and comfortable. There is a lovely roof terrace and restaurant, with stunning views over the city. When we arrived, we had a friendly welcome (and a welcome apple tea) and during our 3 night stay, all the staff were friendly and helpful. A great place, that we'd certainly use again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: cksfinest
Reviews.Content: Brilliant service at this hotel. Everything is was absolutely great. The stay was just right for four nights. Rooms are clean and comfortable and just the right size with nice bathrooms, a good restaurant even though the hotel is near several other restaurants and places to eat. The Ares is in the main touristy area and easily accessible to the rest of the city and airports. Very near to Hagia Sophia museum, the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar and other great places to shop for souvenirs. Customer service is great. Ayhan gave very good service at check-in and gave us directions on how to get to various places throughout the city. Ayhan also gave us great tips on where to shop, eat and places of interest off the beaten path. If you really donâ€™t like large hotels and B&Bs the Ares is the perfect place to stay with all the comforts of home. I would recommend this hotel on a stay to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Well done Ayhan!”
Reviews.Author: carableueyez
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the fabulous Ares Hotel Istanbul. We thought it was brilliant! Beautiful, clean and well kept. Our stay was very quiet and comfortable and I would seriously recommend it to some travelling in the city. It is not expensive and offers a cosy environment. The location is near cafes, restaurants and easily accessible to Istanbul tourist attractions. Even better you can get to it by tram which is right out front. Ayhan the lovely guy at check-in was such a delight. He gave very fast and friendly service. Ayhan is also very informative on restaurant recommendations and fab nightclubs. Such excellent customer service--wonderful job! Our stay at Ares Hotel was one of the best I have ever had in Istanbul and I would stay here again on my next visit to the city. Thanks a million!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: mayday2073
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and quaint small hotel in the Sultanahmet with easy access to all tourist attractions. This is a great little hotel with nice comfortable rooms and showers. Rooms are modern, clean, well kept and furnished just right. The hotel also has restaurant with a terrace offering magical views of the city. Located near several restaurants, cafes, shops and the Sultanahmet tram stops in front making it very easy to get wherever you want. The service at this hotel is magnificent and Ayhan at reception is simply amazing. He is very knowledgeable of the city and keen to assist tourist with their needs. Wonderful service and great job Ayhan! My stay at the Ares Hotel was quiet and hospitable and I would recommend this hotel to someone who wants the comforts of being home away from home.

HotelInfo.Name: Ares Hotel Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Alemdar Mah Incili Cavus Sok No 35 | Sultanahmet Square, Istanbul, Turkey
